parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  While it encourages voting, it doesn't endorse any particular candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The message is general, encouraging civic participation rather than targeting specific individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post seems to be encouraging voter turnout on Romania's National Day, which coincides with the election.  It's a general call to action, not an attempt to sway votes towards a specific candidate or party. The phrasing "Nu, nu intrăm în politică, pur și simplu e un îndemn civic din partea noastră" further supports this interpretation.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. While not strictly journalistic in the traditional sense, the post's message is presented in a manner that could be considered civic engagement or public service announcement. It doesn't present biased information or opinions to influence the vote.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; instead, it promotes a general civic duty.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>877796404337837</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes civic engagement by encouraging voters to participate in the election.  While the timing coincides with the election, the content itself is a general call to vote, not an endorsement of any specific candidate or party. The disclaimer "Nu, nu intrăm în politică, pur și simplu e un îndemn civic din partea noastră" explicitly distances the post from partisan politics. The post does not meet the criteria of Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, as it lacks a direct reference to a specific candidate (a), its objective is civic engagement, not electoral influence (c), and it does not exceed the limits of a public service announcement (d).  The post falls under the category of allowed ads, specifically those of a general nature encouraging civic participation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Salt Bank</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
